metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9644 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The __get_user_asm_ex macro in arch/x86/include/asm/uaccess.h in the Linux kernel 4.4.22 through 4.4.28 contains extended asm statements that are incompatible with the exception table, which allows local users to obtain root access on non-SMEP platforms via a crafted application.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of incorrect backporting of the CVE-2016-9178 patch to older kernels. It was discovered that the __get_user_asm_ex implementation in the Linux kernel for x86/x86_64 contained extended asm statements that were incompatible with the exception table. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9644` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-145-generic - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-lowlatency - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-3.13.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-145.194
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-145-generic - 3.13.0-145.194
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-51-generic - 4.4.0-51.72~14.04.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> 1c109fabbd51863475cd12ac206bdd249aee35af was applied to the 4.4 stable series (in xenial as 1c109fabbd51863475cd12ac206bdd249aee35af) to fix CVE-2016-9178, and then got reverted from stable in 4.4.30 (in xenial as 2da13e7f631bb13658e00e61fdea050da25e69e7). 548acf19234dbda5a52d5a8e7e205af46e9da840 was also very briefly applied to stable in 4.4.29, but reverted at the same time due to problems (in xenial as 102d19689b2dd4f639a14dfd3f52ce19b5d7bb17). For xenial/4.4 derived kernels, this CVE is fixed with the reversion in 2da13e7f631bb13658e00e61fdea050da25e69e7. However, this leaves CVE-2016-9178 unfixed.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '3.13.0-145.194').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-51.72~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '3.13.0-145.194').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-51.72~14.04.1').
